BySteve SchaeferFormer Staff
Nov 28, 2011

Goldman Sachs Borrowed $43.5 Billion From Fed In December, 2008

Thanks to the commendable investigatory services of the Bloomberg media machine, I was startled to learn that as part of a heretofore secret bailout of Wall Street in late 2008 to the tune of almost $8 trillion--- some $4.53 billion of it was borrowed by Goldman Sachs as overnight borrowings from the central bank's open market operations. Understandably-- but not commendably-- the Fed tried to hide the extent of this $8 trillion-- and the users of this largesse-- both domestic and foreign-- so as to cloak just how dire the financial community's straits actually were in those days.
